name: AddProjectDomain
description:
Add a domain to a specified Vercel project.

This tool adds a domain to a Vercel project by specifying the domain name and project identifier (id or name). If the domain is unverified, the response will indicate it needs verification. If the domain already exists, a 400 error will occur.

parameters.name: project_identifier_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the project to which the domain will be added.

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

parameters.name: project_domain_name
parameters.description: The domain name to be added to the specified Vercel project.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the team for which the request is made. This ensures the request is executed on behalf of the specified team.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the team to perform the request on behalf of. This identifies the team context for the domain addition.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: git_branch_to_link_domain
parameters.description: The Git branch to associate with the project domain when adding it to a Vercel project. This allows the domain to be tied to a specific branch in the repository.

value_schema.description: Git branch to link the project domain

parameters.name: custom_environment_id
parameters.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project.

value_schema.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project

parameters.name: redirect_target_domain
parameters.description: Specify the target destination domain to redirect to.

parameters.name: redirect_status_code
parameters.description: HTTP status code for redirecting the domain. Options are: 301, 302, 307, 308, or None.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the vercel API.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

parameters.name: gitBranch
parameters.description: Git branch to link the project domain

value_schema.description: Git branch to link the project domain

parameters.name: customEnvironmentId
parameters.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project

value_schema.description: The unique custom environment identifier within the project
